title: Rewrite equation so all powers have the same base.
text: The first step is to identify the common base of all the terms in the equation.
speech: The first step is to identify the common base of all the terms in the equation.

title: Finding the common base.
text: What is $$6\times6$$? How does this relate to exponents?

title: Finding the common base.

title: Combining terms with the same base.
text: The next step is to rewrite the terms so that they all have the same base and combine the terms on each side of the equation and then solve for $$x$$.
speech: The next step is to rewrite the terms so that they all have the same base and combine the terms on each side of the equation and then solve for  x .

title: Properties of exponents
text: When two terms with the same base are being divided, their exponents are subtracted.
speech: When two terms with the same base are being divided, their exponents are subtracted.
pacedSpeech: When two terms with the same base are being divided, their exponents are subtracted.

title: Taking a power of a power.
text: To take a power of a power, multiply exponents.
speech: To take a power of a power, multiply exponents.
pacedSpeech: To take a power of a power, multiply exponents.

title: One-to-one property of exponents.
text: The one-to-one property of exponential functions states that for any algebraic expressions S and T, and any positive real number $$b$$ (except when $$b$$ $$=$$ 1), $$b^S$$ $$=$$ $$b^T$$ if and only if S $$=$$ T.
